section.title: Statements
section.para: Statements can only appear inside a block and do not have a value.

section.title: block
section.para: A block is an ordered sequence of statements.
Blocks are enclosed in curly braces ({ and }).
Blocks can also be evaluated and therefore have a value. The default value of a block is of type void. Other values can be specified with the return statement.

section.title: return
section.para: The return statement defines the value of the innermost block.

section.title: textdomain
section.para: The textdomain statement is used in conjunction with locales. It defines the translation domain for the locale string. Before using a locale expression, a textdomain must be defined with the textdomain statement.
